title: SMC_MoveAdditionalAxes (FunctionBlock)
text:
FUNCTION_BLOCK FINAL SMC_MoveAdditionalAxes
Moves the additional axes of an axis group without affecting the
axes of the kinematics.  The resulting movement is similar to an
MC_MoveDirectRelative
with zero distance in the coordinate system of
the preceding movement.

rows.Name: AxisGroup
rows.Comment: Reference to a group of axes

rows.Name: Execute
rows.Comment: Start the motion at rising edge

rows:
An instance ofSMC_MoveAdditionalAxesAbsoluteorSMC_MoveAdditionalAxesRelativeshould be assigned to this input. The additional axes of the axis group will perform
the specified movement while this function block is active.

Defines the chronological sequence of the FB relative to the
previous block.

Defines the blending in case of a blending buffer mode.
.. note:-|ioMC_TRANSITION_MODE.TMCornerDistance|relatestothedistancearobot's TCP travels.  For this movementthe TCP distance is always zero, but the preceding movementcan have a non-zero TCP distance.- |ioMC_TRANSITION_MODE.TMStartVelocity| and |ioMC_TRANSITION_MODE.TMAxisDistance|require ``TransitionParameter``[2] to be set for additionalaxes to affect the blending distance.

The maximum velocity of each axis is multiplied by this factor, which
must be in the range ]0, 1].

The maximum acceleration of each axis is multiplied by this factor, which
must be in the range ]0, 1].

The maximum jerk of each axis is multiplied by this factor, which
must be in the range ]0, 1].

rows.Name: Done
rows.Comment: Commanded end positions reached for all axes

rows: Indicates that the FB has control on the axis
Command is aborted by another command

The command has been accepted by the axis group.
If the output becomesTRUE, the function block instance can be used to
command the next movement with a new rising edge onExecute.
While the output isFALSE, keep calling the function block without
a new rising edge ofExecute.
The output is reset toFALSEon a falling edge ofExecute.
Signals that an error has occurred within the function block
The unique identifier of the movement.  Valid ifCommandAcceptedorDoneisTRUE.
